docs: Invalid combination of flags supplied to `seal_call` or `seal_delegate_call`.

variants.name: OutOfGas
docs: The executed contract exhausted its gas limit.

variants.name: TransferFailed
docs: Performing the requested transfer failed. Probably because there isn't enough
free balance in the sender's account.

variants.name: MaxCallDepthReached
docs: Performing a call was denied because the calling depth reached the limit
of what is specified in the schedule.

variants.name: ContractNotFound
docs: No contract was found at the specified address.

variants.name: CodeNotFound
docs: No code could be found at the supplied code hash.

variants.name: CodeInfoNotFound
docs: No code info could be found at the supplied code hash.

variants.name: OutOfBounds
docs: A buffer outside of sandbox memory was passed to a contract API function.

variants.name: DecodingFailed
docs: Input passed to a contract API function failed to decode as expected type.

variants.name: ContractTrapped
docs: Contract trapped during execution.

variants.name: ValueTooLarge
docs: Event body or storage item exceeds [`limits::PAYLOAD_BYTES`].

variants.name: TerminatedWhileReentrant
docs: Termination of a contract is not allowed while the contract is already
on the call stack. Can be triggered by `seal_terminate`.

variants.name: InputForwarded
docs: `seal_call` forwarded this contracts input. It therefore is no longer available.

variants.name: TooManyTopics
docs: The amount of topics passed to `seal_deposit_events` exceeds the limit.

variants.name: DuplicateContract
docs: A contract with the same AccountId already exists.

variants.name: TerminatedInConstructor
docs: A contract self destructed in its constructor.
This can be triggered by a call to `seal_terminate`.

variants.name: ReentranceDenied
docs: A call tried to invoke a contract that is flagged as non-reentrant.

variants.name: ReenteredPallet
docs: A contract called into the runtime which then called back into this pallet.

variants.name: StateChangeDenied
docs: A contract attempted to invoke a state modifying API while being in read-only mode.

variants.name: StorageDepositNotEnoughFunds
docs: Origin doesn't have enough balance to pay the required storage deposits.

variants.name: StorageDepositLimitExhausted
docs: More storage was created than allowed by the storage deposit limit.

variants.name: CodeInUse
docs: Code removal was denied because the code is still in use by at least one contract.

variants.name: ContractReverted
docs: The contract ran to completion but decided to revert its storage changes.
Please note that this error is only returned from extrinsics. When called directly
or via RPC an `Ok` will be returned. In this case the caller needs to inspect the flags
to determine whether a reversion has taken place.

variants.name: CodeRejected
docs: The contract failed to compile or is missing the correct entry points.
A more detailed error can be found on the node console if debug messages are enabled
by supplying `-lruntime::revive=debug`.

variants.name: BlobTooLarge
docs: The code blob supplied is larger than [`limits::code::BLOB_BYTES`].

variants.name: StaticMemoryTooLarge
docs: The contract declares too much memory (ro + rw + stack).

variants.name: BasicBlockTooLarge
docs: The program contains a basic block that is larger than allowed.

variants.name: InvalidInstruction
docs: The program contains an invalid instruction.

variants.name: MaxDelegateDependenciesReached
docs: The contract has reached its maximum number of delegate dependencies.

variants.name: DelegateDependencyNotFound
docs: The dependency was not found in the contract's delegate dependencies.

variants.name: DelegateDependencyAlreadyExists
docs: The contract already depends on the given delegate dependency.

variants.name: CannotAddSelfAsDelegateDependency
docs: Can not add a delegate dependency to the code hash of the contract itself.

variants.name: OutOfTransientStorage
docs: Can not add more data to transient storage.

variants.name: InvalidSyscall
docs: The contract tried to call a syscall which does not exist (at its current api level).

variants.name: InvalidStorageFlags
docs: Invalid storage flags were passed to one of the storage syscalls.

variants.name: ExecutionFailed
docs: PolkaVM failed during code execution. Probably due to a malformed program.

variants.name: BalanceConversionFailed
docs: Failed to convert a U256 to a Balance.

variants.name: InvalidImmutableAccess
docs: Immutable data can only be set during deploys and only be read during calls.
Additionally, it is only valid to set the data once and it must not be empty.

variants.name: AccountUnmapped
docs: An `AccountID32` account tried to interact with the pallet without having a mapping.
Call [`Pallet::map_account`] in order to create a mapping for the account.

variants.name: AccountAlreadyMapped
docs: Tried to map an account that is already mapped.

variants.name: InvalidGenericTransaction
docs: The transaction used to dry-run a contract is invalid.

variants.name: RefcountOverOrUnderflow
docs: The refcount of a code either over or underflowed.

variants.name: UnsupportedPrecompileAddress
docs: Unsupported precompile address.

variants.name: CallDataTooLarge
docs: The calldata exceeds [`limits::CALLDATA_BYTES`].

variants.name: ReturnDataTooLarge
docs: The return data exceeds [`limits::CALLDATA_BYTES`].

variants.name: PoolNotFound
docs: A (bonded) pool id does not exist.

variants.name: PoolMemberNotFound
docs: An account is not a member.

variants.name: RewardPoolNotFound
docs: A reward pool does not exist. In all cases this is a system logic error.

variants.name: SubPoolsNotFound
docs: A sub pool does not exist.

variants.name: AccountBelongsToOtherPool
docs: An account is already delegating in another pool. An account may only belong to one
pool at a time.

variants.name: FullyUnbonding
docs: The member is fully unbonded (and thus cannot access the bonded and reward pool
anymore to, for example, collect rewards).

variants.name: MaxUnbondingLimit
docs: The member cannot unbond further chunks due to reaching the limit.

variants.name: CannotWithdrawAny
docs: None of the funds can be withdrawn yet because the bonding duration has not passed.

variants.name: MinimumBondNotMet
docs: The amount does not meet the minimum bond to either join or create a pool.
The depositor can never unbond to a value less than `Pallet::depositor_min_bond`. The
caller does not have nominating permissions for the pool. Members can never unbond to a
value below `MinJoinBond`.

variants.name: OverflowRisk
docs: The transaction could not be executed due to overflow risk for the pool.

variants.name: NotDestroying
docs: A pool must be in [`PoolState::Destroying`] in order for the depositor to unbond or for
other members to be permissionlessly unbonded.

variants.name: NotNominator
docs: The caller does not have nominating permissions for the pool.

variants.name: NotKickerOrDestroying
docs: Either a) the caller cannot make a valid kick or b) the pool is not destroying.

variants.name: NotOpen
docs: The pool is not open to join

variants.name: MaxPools

variants.name: MaxPoolMembers

variants.name: CanNotChangeState

variants.name: DoesNotHavePermission

variants.name: MetadataExceedsMaxLen

variants.name: Defensive

maintainers.

variants.name: PartialUnbondNotAllowedPermissionlessly

variants.name: MaxCommissionRestricted

variants.name: CommissionExceedsGlobalMaximum

variants.name: CommissionChangeThrottled

variants.name: CommissionChangeRateNotAllowed

variants.name: NoPendingCommission

variants.name: NoCommissionCurrentSet

variants.name: PoolIdInUse

variants.name: BondExtraRestricted

variants.name: NothingToAdjust

variants.name: NothingToSlash

variants.name: SlashTooLow

variants.name: AlreadyMigrated

variants.name: NotMigrated

variants.name: NotSupported

variants.name: Restricted

variants.name: Locked

Possible issues are

variants.name: NotEnoughFunds
docs: The account does not have enough funds to perform the operation.

variants.name: NotAgent
docs: Not an existing `Agent` account.

variants.name: NotDelegator
docs: Not a Delegator account.

variants.name: BadState

variants.name: UnappliedSlash

variants.name: NothingToSlash

variants.name: WithdrawFailed

variants.name: NotSupported

variants.name: Fallback

variants.name: UnexpectedPhase
docs: Unexpected phase

variants.name: TooManyTargets

variants.name: BadTarget

variants.name: CannotChillOther
docs: The user has enough bond and thus cannot be chilled forcefully by an external person.

variants.name: TooManyNominators
docs: There are too many nominators in the system. Governance needs to adjust the staking

variants.name: TooManyValidators

variants.name: CommissionTooLow

variants.name: BoundNotMet

variants.name: ControllerDeprecated
docs: Used when attempting to use deprecated controller account logic.

variants.name: CannotRestoreLedger

variants.name: RewardDestinationRestricted

variants.name: EraNotStarted

variants.name: Restricted
docs: Account is restricted from participation in staking. This may happen if the account is

variants.name: UnappliedSlashesInPreviousEra

variants.name: EraNotPrunable

variants.name: CancelledSlash

variants.name: EarlyPayout

variants.name: PayoutError

variants.name: Inconclusive

Error for the treasury pallet.

variants.name: NotOngoing
docs: Poll is not ongoing.

variants.name: NotVoter
docs: The given account did not vote on the poll.

variants.name: NoPermission
docs: The actor has no permission to conduct the action.

variants.name: NoPermissionYet
docs: The actor has no permission to conduct the action right now but will do in the future.

variants.name: AlreadyDelegating
docs: The account is already delegating.

variants.name: AlreadyVoting
docs: The account currently has votes attached to it and the operation cannot succeed until
these are removed through `remove_vote`.

variants.name: InsufficientFunds
docs: Too high a balance was provided that the account cannot afford.

variants.name: NotDelegating
docs: The account is not currently delegating.

variants.name: Nonsense
docs: Delegation to oneself makes no sense.

variants.name: MaxVotesReached
docs: Maximum number of votes reached.

variants.name: ClassNeeded
docs: The class must be supplied since it is not easily determinable from the state.

variants.name: BadClass
docs: The class ID supplied is invalid.
The `Error` enum of this pallet.

items.name: Account
docs: The full account information for a particular account ID.

items.name: ExtrinsicCount
docs: Total extrinsics count for the current block.

items.name: InherentsApplied
docs: Whether all inherents have been applied.

items.name: BlockWeight
docs: The current weight for the block.

items.name: AllExtrinsicsLen
docs: Total length (in bytes) for all extrinsics put together, for the current block.

items.name: BlockHash
docs: Map of block numbers to block hashes.

items.name: ExtrinsicData
docs: Extrinsics data for the current block (maps an extrinsic's index to its data).

items.name: Number
docs: The current block number being processed. Set by `execute_block`.

items.name: ParentHash
docs: Hash of the previous block.

items.name: Digest
docs: Digest of the current block, also part of the block header.

items.name: Events
docs: Events deposited for the current block.
NOTE: The item is unbound and should therefore never be read on chain.
It could otherwise inflate the PoV size of a block.
Events have a large in-memory size. Box the events to not go out-of-memory
just in case someone still reads them from within the runtime.

items.name: EventCount
docs: The number of events in the `Events<T>` list.

items.name: EventTopics
docs: Mapping between a topic (represented by T::Hash) and a vector of indexes
of events in the `<Events<T>>` list.
All topic vectors have deterministic storage locations depending on the topic. This
allows light-clients to leverage the changes trie storage tracking mechanism and
in case of changes fetch the list of events of interest.
The value has the type `(BlockNumberFor<T>, EventIndex)` because if we used only just
the `EventIndex` then in case if the topic has the same contents on the next block
no notification will be triggered thus the event might be lost.

items.name: LastRuntimeUpgrade
docs: Stores the `spec_version` and `spec_name` of when the last runtime upgrade happened.

items.name: UpgradedToU32RefCount
docs: True if we have upgraded so that `type RefCount` is `u32`. False (default) if not.

items.name: UpgradedToTripleRefCount
docs: True if we have upgraded so that AccountInfo contains three types of `RefCount`. False
(default) if not.

items.name: ExecutionPhase
docs: The execution phase of the block.

items.name: AuthorizedUpgrade
docs: `Some` if a code upgrade has been authorized.

items.name: ExtrinsicWeightReclaimed
docs: The weight reclaimed for the extrinsic.
This information is available until the end of the extrinsic execution.
More precisely this information is removed in `note_applied_extrinsic`.
Logic doing some post dispatch weight reduction must update this storage to avoid duplicate
reduction.

constants.name: BlockWeights
docs: Block & extrinsics weights: base values and limits.

constants.name: BlockLength
docs: The maximum length of a block (in bytes).

constants.name: BlockHashCount
docs: Maximum number of block number to block hash mappings to keep (oldest pruned first).

constants.name: DbWeight
docs: The weight of runtime database operations the runtime can invoke.

constants.name: Version
docs: Get the chain's in-code version.

constants.name: SS58Prefix
docs: The designated SS58 prefix of this chain.
This replaces the "ss58Format" property declared in the chain spec. Reason is
that the runtime should know about the prefix in order to make use of it as
an identifier of the chain.

items.name: UnincludedSegment
docs: Latest included block descendants the runtime accepted. In other words, these are
ancestors of the currently executing block which have not been included in the observed
relay-chain state.
The segment length is limited by the capacity returned from the [`ConsensusHook`] configured
in the pallet.

items.name: AggregatedUnincludedSegment
docs: Storage field that keeps track of bandwidth used by the unincluded segment along with the
latest HRMP watermark. Used for limiting the acceptance of new blocks with
respect to relay chain constraints.

items.name: PendingValidationCode
docs: In case of a scheduled upgrade, this storage field contains the validation code to be
applied.
As soon as the relay chain gives us the go-ahead signal, we will overwrite the
[`:code`][sp_core::storage::well_known_keys::CODE] which will result the next block process
with the new validation code. This concludes the upgrade process.

items.name: NewValidationCode
docs: Validation code that is set by the parachain and is to be communicated to collator and
consequently the relay-chain.
This will be cleared in `on_initialize` of each new block if no other pallet already set
the value.

items.name: ValidationData
docs: The [`PersistedValidationData`] set for this block.
This value is expected to be set only once per block and it's never stored
in the trie.

items.name: DidSetValidationCode
docs: Were the validation data set to notify the relay chain?

items.name: LastRelayChainBlockNumber
docs: The relay chain block number associated with the last parachain block.
This is updated in `on_finalize`.

items.name: UpgradeRestrictionSignal
docs: An option which indicates if the relay-chain restricts signalling a validation code upgrade.
In other words, if this is `Some` and [`NewValidationCode`] is `Some` then the produced
candidate will be invalid.
This storage item is a mirror of the corresponding value for the current parachain from the
relay-chain. This value is ephemeral which means it doesn't hit the storage. This value is
set after the inherent.

items.name: UpgradeGoAhead
docs: Optional upgrade go-ahead signal from the relay-chain.
This storage item is a mirror of the corresponding value for the current parachain from the
relay-chain. This value is ephemeral which means it doesn't hit the storage. This value is
set after the inherent.

items.name: RelayStateProof
docs: The state proof for the last relay parent block.
This field is meant to be updated each block with the validation data inherent. Therefore,
before processing of the inherent, e.g. in `on_initialize` this data may be stale.
This data is also absent from the genesis.

items.name: RelevantMessagingState
docs: The snapshot of some state related to messaging relevant to the current parachain as per
the relay parent.
This field is meant to be updated each block with the validation data inherent. Therefore,
before processing of the inherent, e.g. in `on_initialize` this data may be stale.
This data is also absent from the genesis.

items.name: HostConfiguration
docs: The parachain host configuration that was obtained from the relay parent.
This field is meant to be updated each block with the validation data inherent. Therefore,
before processing of the inherent, e.g. in `on_initialize` this data may be stale.
This data is also absent from the genesis.

items.name: LastDmqMqcHead
docs: The last downward message queue chain head we have observed.
This value is loaded before and saved after processing inbound downward messages carried
by the system inherent.

items.name: LastHrmpMqcHeads
docs: The message queue chain heads we have observed per each channel incoming channel.
This value is loaded before and saved after processing inbound downward messages carried
by the system inherent.

items.name: ProcessedDownwardMessages
docs: Number of downward messages processed in a block.
This will be cleared in `on_initialize` of each new block.

items.name: LastProcessedDownwardMessage
docs: The last processed downward message.
We need to keep track of this to filter the messages that have been already processed.

items.name: HrmpWatermark
docs: HRMP watermark that was set in a block.

items.name: LastProcessedHrmpMessage
docs: The last processed HRMP message.
We need to keep track of this to filter the messages that have been already processed.

items.name: HrmpOutboundMessages
docs: HRMP messages that were sent in a block.
This will be cleared in `on_initialize` of each new block.

items.name: UpwardMessages
docs: Upward messages that were sent in a block.
This will be cleared in `on_initialize` of each new block.

items.name: PendingUpwardMessages
docs: Upward messages that are still pending and not yet send to the relay chain.

items.name: UpwardDeliveryFeeFactor
docs: The factor to multiply the base delivery fee by for UMP.

items.name: AnnouncedHrmpMessagesPerCandidate
docs: The number of HRMP messages we observed in `on_initialize` and thus used that number for
announcing the weight of `on_initialize` and `on_finalize`.

items.name: ReservedXcmpWeightOverride
docs: The weight we reserve at the beginning of the block for processing XCMP messages. This
overrides the amount set in the Config trait.

items.name: ReservedDmpWeightOverride
docs: The weight we reserve at the beginning of the block for processing DMP messages. This
overrides the amount set in the Config trait.

items.name: CustomValidationHeadData
docs: A custom head data that should be returned as result of `validate_block`.
See `Pallet::set_custom_validation_head_data` for more information.

constants.name: SelfParaId
docs: Returns the parachain ID we are running with.

items.name: Now
docs: The current time for the current block.

items.name: DidUpdate
docs: Whether the timestamp has been updated in this block.
This value is updated to `true` upon successful submission of a timestamp by a node.
It is then checked at the end of each block execution in the `on_finalize` hook.

constants.name: MinimumPeriod
docs: The minimum period between blocks.
Be aware that this is different to the *expected* period that the block production
apparatus provides. Your chosen consensus system will generally work with this to
determine a sensible block time. For example, in the Aura pallet it will be double this
period on default settings.

items.name: Cursor
docs: The currently active migration to run and its cursor.
`None` indicates that no migration is running.

items.name: Historic
docs: Set of all successfully executed migrations.
This is used as blacklist, to not re-execute migrations that have not been removed from the
codebase yet. Governance can regularly clear this out via `clear_historic`.

constants.name: CursorMaxLen
docs: The maximal length of an encoded cursor.
A good default needs to selected such that no migration will ever have a cursor with MEL
above this limit. This is statically checked in `integrity_test`.

constants.name: IdentifierMaxLen
docs: The maximal length of an encoded identifier.
A good default needs to selected such that no migration will ever have an identifier
with MEL above this limit. This is statically checked in `integrity_test`.

items.name: StatusFor
docs: The request status of a given hash.

items.name: RequestStatusFor
docs: The request status of a given hash.

items.name: IncompleteSince
docs: Block number at which the agenda began incomplete execution.

items.name: Agenda
docs: Items to be executed, indexed by the block number that they should be executed on.

items.name: Retries
docs: Retry configurations for items to be executed, indexed by task address.

items.name: Lookup
docs: Lookup from a name to the block number and index of the task.
For v3 -> v4 the previously unbounded identities are Blake2-256 hashed to form the v4
identities.

constants.name: MaximumWeight
docs: The maximum weight that may be scheduled per block for any dispatchables.

constants.name: MaxScheduledPerBlock
docs: The maximum number of scheduled calls in the queue for a single block.
NOTE:
+ Dependent pallets' benchmarks might require a higher limit for the setting. Set a
higher limit under `runtime-benchmarks` feature.

items.name: Parameters
docs: Stored parameters.

items.name: TotalIssuance
docs: The total units issued in the system.

items.name: InactiveIssuance
docs: The total units of outstanding deactivated balance in the system.

items.name: Account
docs: The Balances pallet example of storing the balance of an account.
# Example
```nocompile
impl pallet_balances::Config for Runtime {
type AccountStore = StorageMapShim<Self::Account<Runtime>, frame_system::Provider<Runtime>, AccountId, Self::AccountData<Balance>>
You can also store the balance of an account in the `System` pallet.
# Example
```nocompile
impl pallet_balances::Config for Runtime {
type AccountStore = System
But this comes with tradeoffs, storing account balances in the system pallet stores
`frame_system` data alongside the account data contrary to storing account balances in the
`Balances` pallet, which uses a `StorageMap` to store balances data only.
NOTE: This is only used in the case that this pallet is used to store balances.

items.name: Locks
docs: Any liquidity locks on some account balances.
NOTE: Should only be accessed when setting, changing and freeing a lock.
Use of locks is deprecated in favour of freezes. See `https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12951/`

items.name: Reserves
docs: Named reserves on some account balances.
Use of reserves is deprecated in favour of holds. See `https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12951/`

items.name: Holds
docs: Holds on account balances.

items.name: Freezes
docs: Freeze locks on account balances.

constants.name: ExistentialDeposit
docs: The minimum amount required to keep an account open. MUST BE GREATER THAN ZERO!
If you *really* need it to be zero, you can enable the feature `insecure_zero_ed` for
this pallet. However, you do so at your own risk: this will open up a major DoS vector.
In case you have multiple sources of provider references, you may also get unexpected
behaviour if you set this to zero.
Bottom line: Do yourself a favour and make it at least one!

constants.name: MaxLocks
docs: The maximum number of locks that should exist on an account.
Not strictly enforced, but used for weight estimation.
Use of locks is deprecated in favour of freezes. See `https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12951/`

constants.name: MaxReserves
docs: The maximum number of named reserves that can exist on an account.
Use of reserves is deprecated in favour of holds. See `https://github.com/paritytech/substrate/pull/12951/`

constants.name: MaxFreezes
docs: The maximum number of individual freeze locks that can exist on an account at any time.

constants.name: OperationalFeeMultiplier
docs: A fee multiplier for `Operational` extrinsics to compute "virtual tip" to boost their
`priority`
This value is multiplied by the `final_fee` to obtain a "virtual tip" that is later
added to a tip component in regular `priority` calculations.
It means that a `Normal` transaction can front-run a similarly-sized `Operational`
extrinsic (with no tip), by including a tip value greater than the virtual tip.
```rust,ignore
// For `Normal`
let priority = priority_calc(tip);
// For `Operational`
let virtual_tip = (inclusion_fee + tip) * OperationalFeeMultiplier;
let priority = priority_calc(tip + virtual_tip);
Note that since we use `final_fee` the multiplier applies also to the regular `tip`
sent with the transaction. So, not only does the transaction get a priority bump based
on the `inclusion_fee`, but we also amplify the impact of tips applied to `Operational`
transactions.

items.name: Vesting
docs: Information regarding the vesting of a given account.

items.name: StorageVersion
docs: Storage version of the pallet.
New networks start with latest version, as determined by the genesis build.

constants.name: MinVestedTransfer
docs: The minimum amount transferred to call `vested_transfer`.

items.name: Vesting
docs: Vesting schedule for a claim.
First balance is the total amount that should be held for vesting.
Second balance is how much should be unlocked per block.
The block number is when the vesting should start.

items.name: Signing
docs: The statement kind that must be signed, if any.

items.name: Preclaims
docs: Pre-claimed Ethereum accounts, by the Account ID that they are claimed to.

items.name: Author
docs: Author of current block.

items.name: Invulnerables
docs: The invulnerable, permissioned collators. This list must be sorted.

items.name: CandidateList
docs: The (community, limited) collation candidates. `Candidates` and `Invulnerables` should be
mutually exclusive.
This list is sorted in ascending order by deposit and when the deposits are equal, the least
recently updated is considered greater.

items.name: LastAuthoredBlock
docs: Last block authored by collator.

items.name: DesiredCandidates
docs: Desired number of candidates.
This should ideally always be less than [`Config::MaxCandidates`] for weights to be correct.

items.name: CandidacyBond
docs: Fixed amount to deposit to become a collator.
When a collator calls `leave_intent` they immediately receive the deposit back.

constants.name: PotId
docs: Account Identifier from which the internal Pot is generated.

constants.name: MaxCandidates
docs: Maximum number of candidates that we should have.
This does not take into account the invulnerables.

constants.name: MinEligibleCollators
docs: Minimum number eligible collators. Should always be greater than zero. This includes
Invulnerable collators. This ensures that there will always be one collator who can
produce a block.

constants.name: MaxInvulnerables
docs: Maximum number of invulnerables.

constants.name: pot_account
docs: Gets this pallet's derived pot account.

items.name: Validators
docs: The current set of validators.

items.name: CurrentIndex
docs: Current index of the session.

items.name: QueuedChanged
docs: True if the underlying economic identities or weighting behind the validators
has changed in the queued validator set.

items.name: QueuedKeys
docs: The queued keys for the next session. When the next session begins, these keys
will be used to determine the validator's session keys.

items.name: DisabledValidators
docs: Indices of disabled validators.
The vec is always kept sorted so that we can find whether a given validator is
disabled using binary search. It gets cleared when `on_session_ending` returns
a new set of identities.

items.name: NextKeys
docs: The next session keys for a validator.

items.name: KeyOwner
docs: The owner of a key. The key is the `KeyTypeId` + the encoded key.

constants.name: KeyDeposit
docs: The amount to be held when setting keys.

items.name: Authorities
docs: The current authority set.

items.name: CurrentSlot
docs: The current slot of this block.
This will be set in `on_initialize`.

constants.name: SlotDuration
docs: The slot duration Aura should run with, expressed in milliseconds.
The effective value of this type should not change while the chain is running.
For backwards compatibility either use [`MinimumPeriodTimesTwo`] or a const.

items.name: Authorities
docs: Serves as cache for the authorities.
The authorities in AuRa are overwritten in `on_initialize` when we switch to a new session,
but we require the old authorities to verify the seal when validating a PoV. This will
always be updated to the latest AuRa authorities in `on_finalize`.

items.name: RelaySlotInfo
docs: Current relay chain slot paired with a number of authored blocks.
This is updated in [`FixedVelocityConsensusHook::on_state_proof`] with the current relay
chain slot as provided by the relay chain state proof.

items.name: InboundXcmpSuspended
docs: The suspended inbound XCMP channels. All others are not suspended.
This is a `StorageValue` instead of a `StorageMap` since we expect multiple reads per block
to different keys with a one byte payload. The access to `BoundedBTreeSet` will be cached
within the block and therefore only included once in the proof size.
NOTE: The PoV benchmarking cannot know this and will over-estimate, but the actual proof
will be smaller.

items.name: OutboundXcmpStatus
docs: The non-empty XCMP channels in order of becoming non-empty, and the index of the first
and last outbound message. If the two indices are equal, then it indicates an empty
queue and there must be a non-`Ok` `OutboundStatus`. We assume queues grow no greater
than 65535 items. Queue indices for normal messages begin at one; zero is reserved in
case of the need to send a high-priority signal message this block.
The bool is true if there is a signal message waiting to be sent.

items.name: OutboundXcmpMessages
docs: The messages outbound in a given XCMP channel.

items.name: SignalMessages
docs: Any signal messages waiting to be sent.

items.name: QueueConfig
docs: The configuration which controls the dynamics of the outbound queue.

items.name: QueueSuspended
docs: Whether or not the XCMP queue is suspended from executing incoming XCMs or not.

items.name: DeliveryFeeFactor
docs: The factor to multiply the base delivery fee by.

constants.name: MaxInboundSuspended
docs: The maximum number of inbound XCMP channels that can be suspended simultaneously.
Any further channel suspensions will fail and messages may get dropped without further
notice. Choosing a high value (1000) is okay; the trade-off that is described in
[`InboundXcmpSuspended`] still applies at that scale.

constants.name: MaxActiveOutboundChannels
docs: Maximal number of outbound XCMP channels that can have messages queued at the same time.
If this is reached, then no further messages can be sent to channels that do not yet
have a message queued. This should be set to the expected maximum of outbound channels
which is determined by [`Self::ChannelInfo`]. It is important to set this large enough,
since otherwise the congestion control protocol will not work as intended and messages
may be dropped. This value increases the PoV and should therefore not be picked too
high. Governance needs to pay attention to not open more channels than this value.

constants.name: MaxPageSize
docs: The maximal page size for HRMP message pages.
A lower limit can be set dynamically, but this is the hard-limit for the PoV worst case
benchmarking. The limit for the size of a message is slightly below this, since some
overhead is incurred for encoding the format.

items.name: QueryCounter
docs: The latest available query index.

items.name: Queries
docs: The ongoing queries.

items.name: AssetTraps
docs: The existing asset traps.
Key is the blake2 256 hash of (origin, versioned `Assets`) pair. Value is the number of
times this pair has been trapped (usually just 1 if it exists at all).

items.name: SafeXcmVersion
docs: Default version to encode XCM when latest version of destination is unknown. If `None`,
then the destinations whose XCM version is unknown are considered unreachable.

items.name: SupportedVersion
docs: The Latest versions that we know various locations support.

items.name: VersionNotifiers
docs: All locations that we have requested version notifications from.

items.name: VersionNotifyTargets
docs: The target locations that are subscribed to our version changes, as well as the most recent
of our versions we informed them of.

items.name: VersionDiscoveryQueue
docs: Destinations whose latest XCM version we would like to know. Duplicates not allowed, and
the `u32` counter is the number of times that a send to the destination has been attempted,
which is used as a prioritization.

items.name: CurrentMigration
docs: The current migration's stage, if any.

items.name: RemoteLockedFungibles
docs: Fungible assets which we know are locked on a remote chain.

items.name: LockedFungibles
docs: Fungible assets which we know are locked on this chain.

items.name: XcmExecutionSuspended
docs: Global suspension state of the XCM executor.

items.name: ShouldRecordXcm
docs: Whether or not incoming XCMs (both executed locally and received) should be recorded.
Only one XCM program will be recorded at a time.
This is meant to be used in runtime APIs, and it's advised it stays false
for all other use cases, so as to not degrade regular performance.
Only relevant if this pallet is being used as the [`xcm_executor::traits::RecordXcm`]
implementation in the XCM executor configuration.

items.name: RecordedXcm
docs: If [`ShouldRecordXcm`] is set to true, then the last XCM program executed locally
will be stored here.
Runtime APIs can fetch the XCM that was executed by accessing this value.
Only relevant if this pallet is being used as the [`xcm_executor::traits::RecordXcm`]
implementation in the XCM executor configuration.

items.name: AuthorizedAliases
docs: Map of authorized aliasers of local origins. Each local location can authorize a list of
other locations to alias into it. Each aliaser is only valid until its inner `expiry`
block number.

constants.name: UniversalLocation
docs: This chain's Universal Location.

constants.name: AdvertisedXcmVersion
docs: The latest supported version that we advertise. Generally just set it to
`pallet_xcm::CurrentXcmVersion`.

constants.name: MaxLockers
docs: The maximum number of local XCM locks that a single account may have.

constants.name: MaxRemoteLockConsumers
docs: The maximum number of consumers a single remote lock may have.

items.name: Bridge
docs: Bridge that we are using.
**bridges-v1** assumptions: all outbound messages through this router are using single lane
and to single remote consensus. If there is some other remote consensus that uses the same
bridge hub, the separate pallet instance shall be used, In `v2` we'll have all required
primitives (lane-id aka bridge-id, derived from XCM locations) to support multiple  bridges
by the same pallet instance.

items.name: BookStateFor
docs: The index of the first and last (non-empty) pages.

items.name: ServiceHead
docs: The origin at which we should begin servicing.

items.name: Pages
docs: The map of page indices to pages.

constants.name: HeapSize
docs: The size of the page; this implies the maximum message size which can be sent.
A good value depends on the expected message sizes, their weights, the weight that is
available for processing them and the maximal needed message size. The maximal message
size is slightly lower than this as defined by [`MaxMessageLenOf`].

constants.name: MaxStale
docs: The maximum number of stale pages (i.e. of overweight messages) allowed before culling
can happen. Once there are more stale pages than this, then historical pages may be
dropped, even if they contain unprocessed overweight messages.

constants.name: ServiceWeight
docs: The amount of weight (if any) which should be provided to the message queue for
servicing enqueued items `on_initialize`.
This may be legitimately `None` in the case that you will call
`ServiceQueues::service_queues` manually or set [`Self::IdleMaxServiceWeight`] to have
it run in `on_idle`.

constants.name: IdleMaxServiceWeight
docs: The maximum amount of weight (if any) to be used from remaining weight `on_idle` which
should be provided to the message queue for servicing enqueued items `on_idle`.
Useful for parachains to process messages at the same block they are received.
If `None`, it will not call `ServiceQueues::service_queues` in `on_idle`.

constants.name: batched_calls_limit
docs: The limit on the number of batched calls.

items.name: Multisigs
docs: The set of open multisig operations.

constants.name: DepositBase
docs: The base amount of currency needed to reserve for creating a multisig execution or to
store a dispatch call for later.
This is held for an additional storage item whose value size is
`4 + sizeof((BlockNumber, Balance, AccountId))` bytes and whose key size is
`32 + sizeof(AccountId)` bytes.

constants.name: DepositFactor
docs: The amount of currency needed per unit threshold when creating a multisig execution.
This is held for adding 32 bytes more into a pre-existing storage value.

constants.name: MaxSignatories
docs: The maximum amount of signatories allowed in the multisig.

items.name: Proxies
docs: The set of account proxies. Maps the account which has delegated to the accounts
which are being delegated to, together with the amount held on deposit.

items.name: Announcements
docs: The announcements made by the proxy (key).

constants.name: ProxyDepositBase
docs: The base amount of currency needed to reserve for creating a proxy.
This is held for an additional storage item whose value size is
`sizeof(Balance)` bytes and whose key size is `sizeof(AccountId)` bytes.

constants.name: ProxyDepositFactor
docs: The amount of currency needed per proxy added.
This is held for adding 32 bytes plus an instance of `ProxyType` more into a
pre-existing storage value. Thus, when configuring `ProxyDepositFactor` one should take
into account `32 + proxy_type.encode().len()` bytes of data.

constants.name: MaxProxies
docs: The maximum amount of proxies allowed for a single account.

constants.name: MaxPending
docs: The maximum amount of time-delayed announcements that are allowed to be pending.

constants.name: AnnouncementDepositBase
docs: The base amount of currency needed to reserve for creating an announcement.
This is held when a new storage item holding a `Balance` is created (typically 16
bytes).

constants.name: AnnouncementDepositFactor
docs: The amount of currency needed per announcement made.
This is held for adding an `AccountId`, `Hash` and `BlockNumber` (typically 68 bytes)
into a pre-existing storage value.

items.name: BlockToRoot
docs: Stores the last [`Config::MaxStorageRootsToKeep`] block to storage root mappings of the
target chain.

items.name: Accounts
docs: The lookup from index to account.

constants.name: Deposit
docs: The deposit needed for reserving an index.

items.name: Asset
docs: Details of an asset.

items.name: Account
docs: The holdings of a specific account for a specific asset.

items.name: Approvals
docs: Approved balance transfers. First balance is the amount approved for transfer. Second
is the amount of `T::Currency` reserved for storing this.
First key is the asset ID, second key is the owner and third key is the delegate.

items.name: Metadata
docs: Metadata of an asset.

items.name: NextAssetId
docs: The asset ID enforced for the next asset creation, if any present. Otherwise, this storage
item has no effect.
This can be useful for setting up constraints for IDs of the new assets. For example, by
providing an initial [`NextAssetId`] and using the [`crate::AutoIncAssetId`] callback, an
auto-increment model can be applied to all new asset IDs.
The initial next asset ID can be set using the [`GenesisConfig`] or the
[SetNextAssetId](`migration::next_asset_id::SetNextAssetId`) migration.

constants.name: RemoveItemsLimit
docs: Max number of items to destroy per `destroy_accounts` and `destroy_approvals` call.
Must be configured to result in a weight that makes each call fit in a block.

constants.name: AssetDeposit
docs: The basic amount of funds that must be reserved for an asset.

constants.name: AssetAccountDeposit
docs: The amount of funds that must be reserved for a non-provider asset account to be
maintained.

constants.name: MetadataDepositBase
docs: The basic amount of funds that must be reserved when adding metadata to your asset.

constants.name: MetadataDepositPerByte
docs: The additional funds that must be reserved for the number of bytes you store in your
metadata.

constants.name: ApprovalDeposit
docs: The amount of funds that must be reserved when creating a new approval.

constants.name: StringLimit
docs: The maximum length of a name or symbol stored on-chain.

items.name: Class
docs: Details of a collection.

items.name: OwnershipAcceptance
docs: The collection, if any, of which an account is willing to take ownership.

items.name: Account
docs: The items held by any given account; set out this way so that items owned by a single
account can be enumerated.

items.name: ClassAccount
docs: The collections owned by any given account; set out this way so that collections owned by
a single account can be enumerated.

items.name: Asset
docs: The items in existence and their ownership details.

items.name: ClassMetadataOf
docs: Metadata of a collection.

items.name: InstanceMetadataOf
docs: Metadata of an item.

items.name: Attribute
docs: Attributes of a collection.

items.name: ItemPriceOf
docs: Price of an asset instance.

items.name: CollectionMaxSupply
docs: Keeps track of the number of items a collection might have.

constants.name: CollectionDeposit
docs: The basic amount of funds that must be reserved for collection.

constants.name: ItemDeposit
docs: The basic amount of funds that must be reserved for an item.

constants.name: MetadataDepositBase
docs: The basic amount of funds that must be reserved when adding metadata to your item.

constants.name: AttributeDepositBase
docs: The basic amount of funds that must be reserved when adding an attribute to an item.

constants.name: DepositPerByte
docs: The additional funds that must be reserved for the number of bytes store in metadata,
either "normal" metadata or attribute metadata.

constants.name: StringLimit
docs: The maximum length of data stored on-chain.

constants.name: KeyLimit
docs: The maximum length of an attribute key.

constants.name: ValueLimit
docs: The maximum length of an attribute value.

either "normal" metadata or attribute metadata.

items.name: NftToAsset
docs: Keeps track of the corresponding NFT ID, asset ID and amount minted.

docs: The deposit paid by the user locking an NFT. The deposit is returned to the original NFT
owner when the asset is unified and the NFT is unlocked.

constants.name: PalletId
docs: The pallet's id, used for deriving its sovereign account ID.

docs: The newly created asset's symbol.

constants.name: NewAssetName
docs: The newly created asset's name.
